newsitem.title: FRANCE: Canal Plus off heavily on WSJ article.
newsitem.headline: Canal Plus off heavily on WSJ article.

text.p: Shares in pay-tv station Canal Plus fell by more than three percent in early trading on Wednesday after a negative article appeared in the Wall Street Journal, dealers said.

The newspaper said in its "Heard in Paris" column that a majority of European media analysts were recommending that investors sell their stock after last year's merger between Canal Plus and Nethold created "a new degree of uncertainty to the company's performance".
Canal Plus was down 3.3 percent to 1,192 francs at 0945 GMT.
